name: 6-nitro-2-phenyl-3H-indol-3-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3395
Reason: 6-nitro-2-phenyl-3H-indol-3-one has a melting point that we can compare to benzene's melting point of 5.5°C. The basic unit for this compound is indole, which has a melting point around 106°C. The nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The phenyl group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the indole ring itself can contribute to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each indole ring may contribute around +20 to +30°C.
